name: Australia
text: Australian journalist Tracey Spicer announced on Twitter that she was launching an investigation into reports of sexual harassment by powerful Australian men in the media.

name: Afghanistan
text: Sarienews journalist Maryam Mehtar shared her story of experiencing extreme abuse about being sexually harassed in public on a daily basis.

name: Canada
text: Hundreds of people marched to promote #MoiAussi at an event in Toronto.

name: Ethiopia
text: Nine middle-school aged girls organized together and spoke out about an abusive teacher in their school.

name: France
text: French journalist Sandra Muller named the name of a French executive in sharing her story of workplace harassment.

name: India
text: Indian outlets attempted to teach Indian women about workplace rights and safe reporting, as well as to educate men about the scope of the problem.

name: Italy
text: The Montecitorio Palace, normally reserved for the Italian Chamber of Deputies, was occupied solely by women in order to bring emphasis to the issue of sexual assault and society¡¯s ignorance of it.

name: Kenya
text: Human rights reports on sexual violence were published around the 2017 election of Kenya.

name: Norway
text: Trond Giske, the deputy leader of Norway's main opposition Labor Party, was brought to fall by his sexual harassment case.

name: Pakistan
text: Ayesha Gulalai, who then represented Khans party in parliament, alleged that he had sent her inappropriate text messages even after she explicitly asked him not to.

name: South Korea
text: Seo Ji-hyeon, who alleged during a live interview, said that a former South Korean Ministry of Justice official, Ahn Tae-geun, groped her during a funeral in 2010.

name: Sweden
text: Tens of thousands of Swedish women have signed a series of appeals in the national press detailing incidents of brutal sexual assault and harassment.

name: Spain
text: Spanish journalist Cristina Fallaras posted her own multiple experiences of abuse on Twitter and encouraged other women to share their stories.

name: United Kingdom
text: The politics and culture writer Kate Maltby from Times described the sexual harassment she received from Damian Green, one of the highest-ranking ministers in the Cabinet.

name: Japan
text: The popular blogger and writer Haruka Ito spoke about her experience with sexual harassment.

name: China
text: Luo Xixi, a PhD student at Beihang University poster her story on Weibo about the sexual assault she received from her superviser Chen Xiaowu.

name: Germany
text: German actress Nina Brandhoff spoke publicly about the problem of sexual harassment in the entertainment industry.

name: Taiwan
text: Several women rights organizations in Taiwan collectively set up a website and a hotline for sexual assaults and harassment victims.

name: Finland
text: Finnish former high school students raised their voices on the sexual harassment from their male teachers.
